intro: Cyrtandra olokuiensis, commonly known as the Olokui Endemic Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Olokui. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. The plant grows in moist, shaded habitats, often found in forest understories where it thrives in the cool, humid environment. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, Cyrtandra olokuiensis is considered a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in preserving its natural habitat.
